column4: I have multiple e-mail addresses and I like to use Thunderbird to aggregate them, the checking, etc. Sometimes I use Windows though and like to check things there. Sometimes I use Ubuntu and check things here. Anyone have suggestions as to how I can synchronize the data in Thunderbird so I can see the same e-mails in both OS (as well as deletes affecting both inboxes, etc.) ?
You could make your Ubuntu Thunderbird profile directory a symbolic link to your Windows'
/home/username/.mozilla-thunderbird, you'll see a folder with a random name like "dja185jq.default"... That's the folder you'll need to symlink
Thanks for the symlink advice for Thunderbird. :)
